name: Dinner Tonight: Broiled Ham Steaks
description: Jacques Pepin, distinguished private chef, poet, HoJo consultant, and author of some of the thickest tomes of culinary education, also likes to eat on time. Although he’s recently been strutting his stuff on PBS hawking his 2004 cookbook Fast Food...

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the broiler. Wrap some foil around a baking sheet, and place the steaks atop so they don’t overlap.
Mix the ketchup, brown sugar, hot sauce, and dry mustard until smooth. Slather on the ham steaks with a brush.
Place the pan about 5 inches under the broiler. Cook until the sauce caramelizes and the ham is heated through, about 5 minutes.
